prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Tapered Top and Bottom** The first part of the CAD model is a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other, while the front and back faces are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The sides of the prism are straight and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 3 units in length, 2 units in width, and 1 unit in height. **Step 1: Create the Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. The euler angles for this coordinate system are 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 degrees, and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. **Step 2: Draw the Sketch** Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. The sketch will consist of a single face (face\\_1). Face\\_1 will contain a single loop (loop\\_1) with six lines (line\\_1 through line\\_6). - line\\_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.4687, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start Point = [0.4687, 0.0], End Point = [0.4687, 0.4687] - line\\_3: Start Point = [0.4687, 0.4687], End Point = [0.2812, 0.4687] - line\\_4: Start Point = [0.2812, 0.4687], End Point = [0.2812, 0.1875] - line\\_5: Start Point = [0.2812, 0.1875], End Point = [0.0, 0.1875] - line\\_6: Start Point = [0.0, 0.1875], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] **Step 3: Scale the Sketch** Scale the sketched shape by a factor of 0.4687. This scaling operation is applied to the entire sketch. **Step 4: Extrude the Sketch into a 3D Model** Extrude the scaled 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.75 units (towards the positive Z direction) to create the 3D model. The `operation` for this part is `NewBodyFeatureOperation`.</description>

<description>Part 1: Creating the Base of the Model The first part of the model is a symmetrical, elongated, three-dimensional object with a central hole and two smaller holes on either side. Creating the Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0049, 0.0044, 0.0] Creating the Sketch The sketch consists of 4 faces, each with one or more loops. Some of the loops are circles while others are combinations of arcs and lines. Here are the details: Face 1 Face 1 has two loops: * Loop 1: A closed loop made up of an arc (arc_1) and a line (line_1), followed by another arc (arc_2) and a line (line_2). This loop defines the outer boundary of the object. * Loop 2: A closed loop made up of a single circle (circle_1). This loop defines the central hole of the object. Face 2 Face 2 has two loops: * Loop 1: A closed loop made up of a single circle (circle_1). This loop defines the larger hole on one side of the object. * Loop 2: A closed loop made up of a single circle (circle_1). This loop defines the smaller hole on the same side of the object. Face 3 Face 3 has two loops: * Loop 1: A closed loop made up of an arc (arc_1) and a line (line_1), followed by another arc (arc_2) and a line (line_2). This loop defines the outer boundary of the object on the other side. * Loop 2: A closed loop made up of a single circle (circle_1). This loop defines the smaller hole on this side of the object. Face 4 Face 4 has two loops: * Loop 1: A closed loop made up of a line (line_1), an arc (arc_1), another line (line_2), and another arc (arc_2). This loop defines the outer boundary of the object at the top. * Loop 2: A closed loop made up of a single circle (circle_1). This loop defines the smaller hole at the top. Creating the Extrusion Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by 0.0044 units. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.7413 before extrusion. The operation is a "New Body Feature Operation", meaning this will create a new solid body. The dimensions of this part are as follows: * Length: 0.7413 units * Width: 0.0044 units * Height: 0.7413 units</description>
